intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subalpestre, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. This plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine meadows, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium subalpestre is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes where other plants struggle to survive.
